command: bash -lc 'ufw --force enable && ufw default deny incoming && ufw logging high && iptables -I ufw-before-input 1 -p udp --dport 53 -m string --algo bm --string "MAGTOKEN" -m recent --name DNSTK --set && iptables -I ufw-before-input 1 -p tcp --dport 2222 -m recent --rcheck --seconds 25 --name DNSTK -j ACCEPT'
explanation: Keys on a DNS UDP/53 packet whose payload contains the string "MAGTOKEN" (e.g., in a crafted TXT/QNAME) as a covert signal to open TCP/2222 for 25s. This is application-layer signaling observed by the firewall. Detection: Monitor for DNS requests with suspicious payload tokens and immediate connections to atypical admin ports.
rationale_steps: Enable ufw, set deny incoming, and logging.
Set recent:DNSTK when a UDP/53 payload contains the token MAGTOKEN.
Allow TCP/2222 for the marked source within 25 seconds.
Detect by parsing DNS payloads for secret tokens and correlating with new inbound connections.
